subComponents.description: Prognostic, single-moment bulk scheme for sulphate, organic carbon, black carbon, sea salt, and mineral dust (online). Emissions for sulphur dioxide and organic and black carbon according to CMIP5. References: Lohmann, U., K. von Salzen, N. McFarlane, H. G. Leighton, and J. Feichter, 1999, Tropospheric sulphur cycle in the Canadian general circulation model, J. Geophys. Res., 104, 26,833-26,858; Croft, B., U. Lohmann, and K. von Salzen, 2005, Black carbon ageing in the Canadian Centre for Climate modelling and analysis atmospheric general circulation model, Atmos. Chem. Phys., 5, 1931-1949.

properties.description: The pre-industrial, historical and future (RCP) anthropogenically affected concentrations  (available from the website at IIASA http://www.iiasa.ac.at/web-apps/tnt/RcpDb/dsd?Action=htmlpage&page=welcome).  Use CFC11 in the radiation code to include the effect of the 26 trace gases:  CFC_11,CF4,C2F6,C6F14,HFC23,HFC32,HFC43_10,HFC125,HFC134a,HFC143a,HFC227ea,HFC245fa,SF6,CFC_113,CFC_114,CFC_115,CARB_TET,MCF,HCFC_22,HCFC_141B,HCFC_142B,HALON1211,HALON1301,HALON2402,CH3BR,CH3CL.

The pre-industrial, historical and future (RCP) anthropogenically affected concentrations  (available from the website at IIASA http://www.iiasa.ac.at/web-apps/tnt/RcpDb/dsd?Action=htmlpage&page=welcome).

The pre-industrial, historical and future (RCP) anthropogenically affected concentrations  (available from the website at IIASA http://www.iiasa.ac.at/web-apps/tnt/RcpDb/dsd?Action=htmlpage&page=welcome)

The pre-industrial, historical and future (RCP) anthropogenically affected concentrations  (available from the website at IIASA http://www.iiasa.ac.at/web-apps/tnt/RcpDb/dsd?Action=htmlpage&page=welcome)

The pre-industrial, historical and future (RCP) anthropogenically affected concentrations  (available from the website at IIASA http://www.iiasa.ac.at/web-apps/tnt/RcpDb/dsd?Action=htmlpage&page=welcome)

The solar input was derived from the SOLARIS website http://www.geo.fu-berlin.de/en/met/ag/strat/forschung/SOLARIS/Input_data/CMIP5_solar_irradiance.html.
Anomaly time series about 1850 values for each of the 12 spectral bands in the model were derived from this dataset and added as a perturbation to the model for the period 1850-2008.  After 2008, the solar cycle was included in the model by repetition of the last (23rd) 12-yr solar cycle (1997-2008).

values: Secular variation for each band in radiative transfer model using data from Lean 2009
Computed for each day of year using orbital parameters for 1950

values: Specified aerosol optical depth based on data from Sato et al. 1993

subComponents.description:
KPP vertical mixing as in
Large, W. G., . C. Williams, and S. C. Doney, 1994: Oceanic vertical mixing:a review and a model with a nonlocal boundary layer parameterization. Rev. Geophys., 32, 363–403.

properties.description:
Equation of State as implemented in MOM1 : Knudsen polynomial

North pole treatment as described  in Gent et al J. Phys Oceanogr 1998

The Barotropic Streamfunction was  solved by using a pre-conditioned conjugate gradient solver  

River mixing: Half of freshwater fluxes from rivers into ocean are deposited evenly into the six ocean grid cells underlying the atmospheric model grid cell corresponding to the river outflow. The other half is deposited evenly into the ocean cells underlying all adjacent non-land atmospheric model cells. All such fluxes are deposited in the top ocean layer.
